Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Philionet
Reviews.Content: We are checking out today stayed in room 507. The room was clean bed firm and low but a great sleep for us and the staff extremely friendly. They spoke English and very helpful regarding  directions and sites. One thing to consider: if calling for pickup at the airport, it may be a while since the driver is also the front desk clerk working dual jobs when busy. This is not a problem getting to the port or airport on time. The breakfast bar is excellent however I suggest if you are coming from the states and a coffee drinker for you to bring some artificial sweetener with you as we always do. They didnt have any also coffee cream since they use milk. If you are new traveling to Europe make sure you have a converter for curling irons however a basic adapter will work on other electronic devices. Internet access was excellent and free for all devices. Also the phones did not have id on how to call the front desk. Just dial 9.  Remember to put you key in the wall for lights and air to work. Taxi fare to or from Placa de Catalunya and tours bus lines was approx 17 euros per visit. This hotel is worth the stay and priced great! I hope this review helps the new and pro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and worthy of 4 * Rating”
Reviews.Author: Alan641348
Reviews.Content: A really great Hotel. Very clean rooms - superb service! Great welcome from very professional reception staff - who spoke English and gave us some good advice on travel and sightseeing - without the usual push to sell something! We arrived on 16th April and were in room 302 - and don't recognise the previous review. Our room was quiet and well ventilated. No AC but in April not necessary. We stayed 4 nights. Room service excellent. Breakfast Buffet - one the very best we have come accross - and well worthy of the 4 *'s - excellent food very well presented and a great choice. I booked via LAte Rooms at around E100 a night INCLUDING breakfast

Reviews.Title: “whoosh, bang, crash and wallop”
Reviews.Author: bicycleben
Reviews.Content: Do not come here at any cost if your a light sleeper. We were first put in 211, the room with no AC and next to the boiler so it sounded like we had witches living in our walls! After asking to be moved because of this, they said they could only make arrangements for the next day, ok. We were then put in 208, thinking this would change things, on entry the room was cooler and less stuffy. However once again, and I think this must be for every room, any neighbouring flush or use of water facilities comes flowing through your room and during the night the AC packed up. Then at 0830 started, what sounded like, a door banging and bed dragging olympics, or at least someone was trying to claw and slam their way through our walls! Oh and the spa, not much of one at all! The pool is a square of 3mx3m with the altering height from 1m to 1.20m, and lots of attachments. If there are children there then expect all the jets to be on and them diving in unsupervised. The hottub is a very intimate 2 man-er with a huge cold stone overhang so dont expect to get comfy. There's also a subtle hint of cheesiness. The sauna is a box that only gets to 20 Celsius, might as well stay in the room. And the "spa showers" is just four showers that sequentially blast you with either hot then cold or cold then hot. Their benefits are explained but I think a little far fetched. The one redeeming feature is the steam room, the only positive to come out of this hotel. We have one more night here, lets hope for some quiet. (Personally i would suggest the Silken Diagonal Hotel as a better choice.)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: brendaontravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 days. Booked this hotel as needed a triple room. Large clean comfortable room which could get a little hot and stuffy, but with an open window and the a/c blowing cool air at night we managed. Buffet breakfast not included @ 13 euros each, unless you eat a lot, is not worth spending, there are a few local cafes where you can get what you want for less. Indoor pool and spa facilities are available but small, so it can get crowded, but it is a useful facility - according to my Grandkids (14 & 16). This hotel is close to Bogatell Station, 3 minutes walk, and you can be in the centre of town within 15 minutes, trains are frequent. It is also 12 minutes walk from the beach and some good restaurants. Staff are friendly and helpful. I am pleased with my choice and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: nick3317
Reviews.Content: good for a week end not far from metro station. walls are a little to thin it is easy to hear what happen next door make sure that if you go their to go within 2 years as some damages start appearing and not looked after

Reviews.Title: “Good, but needs refining”
Reviews.Author: RickDChick
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in the summer. Well air conditioned comfortable room with free mini bar. The room needed a few touch ups, but on the whole was decent for a quick sleep and off out again. Breakfast was very basic continental. A pleasant experience, did the job.

Reviews.Title: “OK but very expensive and far from any night-life etc”
Reviews.Author: twinklestar2307
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during MWC a major exhibition which takes place yearly. It was very overpriced but thats the nature of the hotels furing this time. My small single room was on the 8th floor, only saving grace was the small terrace that it had, smallish bathroom. The public areas are nice, plenty of seating in the lobby area which is also the bar area, I waited for 10 mins to be served at the bar and eventually had to go and ask the receptionist if it was open. The breakfast was 13euro - not worth it. Didnt eat in the restaurant so cannot comment or use th spa/pool. Its a bit out of the way from Les Ramblas and the other tourist attractions of Barcelona, there is a metro within walking distance and you can walk to the beach - 15 mins. All in all for the money spent I could have got something more central.

Reviews.Title: “Like a stream room”
Reviews.Author: pw_lami
Reviews.Content: I visit this hotel in March 2012, the weather is still cold. The hotel just provides warm air only, but it is too hot, even I turn off the heater, my husband and I were still sweating although we just wear vest!!!! So we cannot sleep all the night. The staff just told us to open the window and this is the only way we can do. This is a strange experience that while your room's temperature is over 35 degree Celsius, outside temperature is just 0 degree Celsius!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good as expect it!”
Reviews.Author: Gynter
Reviews.Content: We visit this hotel once. For four star hotel you expect more! The room was clean but with one small window on the swemming pool side! For the same money you can have a better one ! The pool is very very small!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: LHPW
Reviews.Content: We had 3 double rooms for 5 of us on a 5 day stay. The rooms were a good size, very clean and well appointed. The staff were all extremely helpful and advised us on any query we had. The breakfast buffet was very well laid out and enjoyable, setting us all up for the day before heading out. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Bogatell metro station which in turn is 5 stops from the central area of Ramblas / Catalunya Plaza. Also the hotel is a 15 minute walk to the old marina (loads of restaurants) and the beach area. Overall, the hotel offered excellent value for money, was spotlessly clean, was very friendly and in a good location for accessing wherever - I would certainly recommend it to any visitor to the City.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great!”
Reviews.Author: Yosee O
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel since it was highly rated in the internet, honestly I don't understand why... Don't get me wrong the hotel is beautiful and the restaurant is good but: 1. They charge visitors of the hotel for parking in their own parking lot. 2. They charge separately for breakfast - 7 EURO for juice and a toast??? 3, They charge for printing a page. You get the point - They charge for all they can. Also we took a twin bed room and I almost fell out of the bed since it is fairly small.

Reviews.Title: “made it a great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: sarahlowe26
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel after loads and loads of review reading on tripadvisor. very good value £200 for 3 nights- friday to monday, including breakfast and spa use (didnt use spa) for me and my partner. hotel is a 5 minute walk from Bogatell metro line, which although doesnt take you directly to placa de catalunya you can easily transfer to another line. 15 minute walk to beach and is close to technological district. surrounding area isnt fantastic but alot of regenration work is going on, plus when you enter the hotel you forget about whats outside. definately warrants its 4 stars, helpful staff, lovely breakfast, beatiful room and nice bar area and foyer. only minor complaint is that AC blows warm air in winter, and when we were there temperature was 18 degrees so room without AC was hot- plus we were facing the swimming room which made it extra warm. some nice touches like the his and hers toiletries in the bathroom and minibar with bottles of water and juice which was free! would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 1981Girltraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights in February and it was a great experience. Very helpfull staff gave us advice on tourist attractions and transport system (also provided the map). The room turned out to be really comfy and spacious. We had clean bathroom and even a little hall - our beds t'were made every day, we also got free drinks. Well working AC. And now the breakfast which was amazing - buffet where you could chose whatever you wanted. Great selection of variety of food (meat, cheese, fruits, dairy products, cornflakes, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, bacon, sausages juices, coffee and many more). As fas as transport is concerned, there is a bus stop few steps from the hotel entrance and metro station 5 minute walk from it ( metro Bogatell - yellow line). overall, the hotel makes a very good impression, it's clean, comfortable and quite close to the city centre (just few metro and bus stops) and it's within walking distance to the beach. We would definately return there.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel a bit far from the center.”
Reviews.Author: flaaterud
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay. Check out the bars in the back street.

Reviews.Title: “January break including footie match!”
Reviews.Author: millieg0605
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in Barcelona and this hotel was ideal for our needs. It was 3/4 stops from the centre depending on where you wanted to go. Initially the area doesn't look great but we never encountreded any problems, it was really quiet. It was a nice walk to the Glories area if you dont want to venture into the main city centre. The only gripe I did have was having to pay to use the spa facilities, this should be a bonus of choosing the hotel not an added cost. Overall I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely with a stunning view to the sea and right across the city from our large balcony. The area around the hotel may initially look rough but it has a lot of charm an provides a real slice of life in comparison to the more touristy areas of the city. The location is actually excellent for accessing any attractions. Staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Umm... Bathrooms are gross”
Reviews.Author: YamAmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December... The buffet breakfast is really quite nice, the beds are relatively clean, but the bathrooms in the rooms are disgusting. There were bugs feeling up the wall, grime on the tiles, a broken tap and little bits of finger nails. This was all like this when I walked in. The area is full of grotty flats, graffiti and really dodgy looking people. Most of them were drunk. Not a nice area

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: prairiegirlmanitoba
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the four nights we stayed at this hotel. It was very quiet for sleeping and our suite was very clean and comfortable. The front desk staff were helpful in showing us different things to see around Barcelona. Metro station was close by and we also found a few restaurants nearby as well. The breakfast buffet offered was expensive but had lots of variety, the spa was small but well-equipped. We felt the room needed an alarm clock. We are used to getting a small fridge and a microwave in our North American hotel rooms, and we missed those conveniences. However, our view from the ninth floor was wonderful and we enjoyed the lights of Barcelona at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ciatonelli
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. Good service and nice rooms. The Spa was small but great, perfect after a day of walking around all day.The breakfast buffet was good but we missed real bread, just toasts.The had their own parking wihich was great but very narrow to get in and out, so not for someone with a big car. The location was great, 15 min walk to the sea, Olympic, and less than 5 min walk to the metro.20 min walk to the Sagrada Familia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but in a run down area”
Reviews.Author: sunlver95
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our brief stay here before our cruise departed. Its located east of downtown, so a bit pricey 35 euro taxi ride from the airport. The surrounding area is semi-residential and light industrial. Surprisingly few restaurants nearby, and the streets are spooky deserted at night, guess everyone has gone downtown! Front desk staff spoke good english and were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast room had a small selection of foods but were tasty enough. Hallways in the hotel are more than colorful. Rooms were good sized and comfortable. Nice to have windows you can open for fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the district”
Reviews.Author: Purrpuss
Reviews.Content: We were there as an extended family on Sunday between disembarking from a cruise and flying home. The hotel is very close to Bogatell metro and from here only four stops to Uruquinaoa which is a small block from Placa Catalunya but the area in which it is situated is decidedly seedy and run down looking but didn't feel unsafe if you kept to the main carrers which were well lit. The hotel itself was lovely with big rooms and a large atrium and bar area on the ground floor but the restaurant was closed and only a limited range of bar food was available. This all looked as if it was pre frozen and had just been heated up. One of the children with us asked for a plain cheese pizza and was told only ham and cheese was available. Surely not rocket science to remove the ham before serving? My partner and I decided to explore the area and find an alternative eating place. We were told the hotel was 15 minutes walk to Port Olimpic but it was closer to 30 and we aren't slow walkers. The area in which the hotel is situated looks to be semi industrial and most of the restaurants in the immediate area were closed on Sunday night. Port Olimpic was fine and we had a very nice meal there on the waterfront. We liked our room with two generous single beds pushed together to make a huge double. The bathroom was very large with both bidet and toilet but the door stop was set in the floor right at the base of the toilet and I stubbed my toe a couple of times. Also the shower is over a bath with high sides and a bit tricky to get out of if you are starting to stiffen up. At first I thought the selection of toiletries was poor but later discovered we had been given two male ones instead of a male and a female version. The spa was amazing. Just the thing for aches and stiff necks and the pool was a pleasant 28C. The main disappoint ment here was that there were a group of pre-teens who didn't seem to have parents with them and were splashing about rather a lot. However this wasn't the fault of the hotel. Overall this is a nice hotel with good features but its situation lets it down. We'd probably stay again for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good City Break Location with great spa and free wifi”
Reviews.Author: Lichfieldlisa
Reviews.Content: Good location, dont be put off by the shuttered restuarants nearby, when open they are little gems used by the locals and minutes walk from the Metro station. Nice hotel, great bar, rooms lovely with fridge and complmentary soft drinks on arrival. We arrived before the room was ready but was able to leave our luggage and explore. Breakfast has a good selction but get there some time before it closes as there was little left. The simming pool was not for swimming but a square pool with spa style taps to sit under and get massaged. There was 4 showers that offered different sensations, I just wish I had more time to spend there. Only downside is there was no where to sit outside but for a autumn/winter break this hotel is ideal and the local bars/restuarants are a must. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sweetdaisy524
Reviews.Content: I was surprised how nice this hotel was. Nice staff, nice rooms, bathrooms, good breakfast, spa, pool, etc. Being close to the beach was amazing and only a block away from the metro. Totally pleased and would stay there again. Only hotel in Spain that didn't charge us for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spacious wheelchair accessible room”
Reviews.Author: brownie1984
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in the middle of a weird run down industrial area it is very well located for the beach and Ramblas Room 410 is 9/10 for disabled. I am unable to walk and found this room more than adequate for a weekend. Only improvement would be a roll in shower. Bath seat was ok but the shower door didn't move so it made it a bit of squeeze getting in to the bath. Breakfast was good. Good variety and fresh fruit etc Taxi from and to airport approx 35 euros. Depends on who u get!! They love to add supplements to overall cost Bar was good for a hotel the prices were fair. 4 euros for a large sangria or large beer

Reviews.Title: “good hotel business light industrial area”
Reviews.Author: eeaaeeaa
Reviews.Content: extra charge to use the pool 8 euros per person, small pool not really aimed at children Taxi cost 75 euros from airport ,only 30 on the way back. close to metro but streets quite late a night. Can walk 10 mins to beach and lots of seafood restauraunts hotel staff lovely and hotel clean and quiet good breakfast choice

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingKaat
Reviews.Content: we came to Europe with the expectation that this would be a small room. i got a vacation package for our trip, so i wasn't really aware how much of that package went to hotel expenses, but i think its about 100$+. for that price we paid through our package, i must say this hotel was superb! the room was big, clean, and well-lit. the bathroom, in fact, was big and clean, too. toiletries were provided and packaged in the most-attractive way. breakfast, in itself, expected my expectations. the breakfast buffet was an assortment of fruits, breads, cold meats, cheeses, drinks. i can only wish US hotels served that kind of breakfast. additionally, the place where the hotel was located was safe, even at night. i had tried going out late at night and came home around midnight with my 6-yr old daughter and it was uneventful. the metro's yellow line was only 2 blocks from the hotel, too. the only thing that was a turn-off was the spa/pool. it wasnt inviting enough. not quite kid-friendly. unfortunately, despite that being a europe trip, which me and my husband were both excited about, the pool was the only thing my daughter was looking forward to in spain. overall, id say it was a wonderful experience with this hotel. PLEASE DONT EVEN BE BOTHERED BY THE PHOTOS YOU SEE OF THE RED AND WHITE STRIPES. THEY INITIALLY APPEALED TO ME AS CHEAP IN THE PHOTOS BUT THEY LOOKED PLEASANT IN PERSON, IN FACT.

Reviews.Title: “Clean big rooms convenient location monotonous cuisine”
Reviews.Author: Theretailer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by myself for week ,on the first day I was given a very small room owing to the fact I had to check in earlier than expected ,on the next day I shifted to a bigger room,and all is forgiven (I had made reservations 4months in advance) the view was of a down town deserted street a few cafes .The atmosphere serene ,the rooms are spacious with ample closet space,my bath room did not have a hygiene faucet .The television was an LCD with only one english channel the BBC the audio of which was not working half the time so I had to resort to lip reading to keep a track of the markets the rest were all Spanish and other European chanels ,the wireless connection was pathetic ,needless to say my VoIP did not work,which was frustrating,the rooms were however promptly cleaned every day ,good housekeeping ,on the weekends the restaurant closes so you have to resort to room service which is extra including vat service fees and what not,the breakfast buffet is a plus,very popular among residents value for money 12€ but the content is same throughout ,the restaurant menu has only Spanish cuisine with a few Italian dishes I must suggest to the chef to introduce American,Bristish ,Arabic and a few Indian dishes to cater to all palates ,the waiters&waitresses were polite and the reception staff quite helpful all of them spoke English and were quite professional not very far from the beach and the centre of town the neighbourhood is a bit run down but has a sprinkling of bars and wayside cafes ,during the weekends a club outside makes a lot of noise especially if the party goes onto the street .

Reviews.Title: “MY SIXTH STAY”
Reviews.Author: STUART51
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel that delivers every time. The location is away from the city centre but by using the metro (Bogatell located around the block) you can be any where in the city in a very little time. Use the T10 card and the metro is a cheap way to travel. The reception staff are exceptional,Crisanta, Yvonne,David and the other reception staff cannot do enough to make your stay an enjoyable one. The cleaning staff also deserve recognition the rooms and public areas are immaculately clean. Breakfast in a lovely bright room caters for the most fussy of eaters the choices available are so varied you cannot fail to leave the room satisfied and content ready to start your sightseeing day. My room(double for single use) was of a medium size but had everything required for an enjoyable stay. I look forward to seeing Magnuss and his team again next year.

Reviews.Title: “2 blocks from metro station - bogatell. Big clean room.”
Reviews.Author: Stm_eternity
Reviews.Content: It's not right at centre of action which I like - don't like the city centre full of crowded ppl. This hotel is in a neighborhood about 5 mins train to barceloneta. Very convenient, u only need to walk 2 blocks to get to the metro station. Some part of this neighborhood is quite ghetto, but the immediate area seems quite safe - a few snack bars and convenience store nearby. Not really any fancy restaurants. There's also a supermarket about 15 mins walk away. Like a lot of other cities, grafiti every corner of the streets, but I dont feel unsafe during the day. The room is big, clean laminated floor and bathroom. The shower works well. The AC works well, but when u turn it too high, the water starts to drip down the ceiling, but it's ok when the setting is lower. The bathroom is down the hallway of the room, so the room doesn't feel steamy after shower, there're also windows in the room that can be opened for fresh air, although our room is facing the street, so can get pretty noisy if u leave windows open at night when u sleep. There's a gym here, it's ok, nothing special. Breakfast is not included, water is only complimentary on first day of stay, so make sure to pick up some on the way back from metro, water in hotel is expensive, no need when u can spend less than half the amount a block down the street. Cab ride only 30 mins from airport, €30, save us hassle and time from taking the train! Only 15-20 mins walk to the beach. Due to room size and price, and convenience , I would recommend this hotel. Staff wise, somewhat helpful, not super friendly, but barcelona is very easy to get around, didn't require much of their help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Miken77
Reviews.Content: Just left the hotel after a 5 night stay in barcelona. As the weather was great we were mostly hanging out on the beach which is about 10 min walk from the hotel. The neighbourhood where the hotel is a bit rundown bit it dies not feel unsafe and there is a metro just around the corner. All the hotel staff we came across were helpful and the breakfast buffet was good. Will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service and bad location”
Reviews.Author: Bearcatcoupon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Salles Hotel Pere IV from June 13-16. It was a very unpleasant experience. The customer service people was not professional. They did not return the phone call they promised. The hang up the call or letting the customer hold on the line and forgot about it. The story began with poor hotel room condition that was leaking the water at midnight from ceiling. My wife almost fall. The hall way was full of water. So we had to change from room 407 to 413. You can imagine having all this hassle and discomfort in the middle of the night. In a hurry a Zara bag that has a black jacket my wife purchased was left in the original room 407. We called the room service. But the response was really disappointing. They told me that they will call me back, which never happened. I have to call the front desk and explain the incidence again and again as if there were no record at all that I was called before. Nobody was trying to do due diligence to help a customer. I am extremely unhappy. Also the location is very bad, it's very far from the center of the downtown Barcelona, and there isn't lots of good entertainment/restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, very clean with large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Rudge187069
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel with a group of 18 of us. The hotel is lovely, the rooms were big and very clean. The hotel staff were helpful and seemed really organised, they put our rooms next to each other on the same floor which was great and even let us check in early The breakfast was lovely lots to choose from, when we were going home there was a safe locked room to put your cases. We all said we would definately stay at this hotel when we come again. Just a warning got a taxi from the hotel to the airport which was 24 going and for some reason 43 going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in Downtown Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: telaragna
Reviews.Content: Nice and fun hotel in downtown barcelona just two metro stations from catalunia square. Nice rooms and size as well. We spend several days with friends and the breakfast was not bad as well. Outstanding staff, francesco was nice and professional. We do suggest the hotel to some friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, sleep quality compromised during winters”
Reviews.Author: Drumas
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. Rooms are very clean having space enough if you have more baggage. Bathrooms very good. Service is good and staff is very helpful all the time. Rooms are very comfortable, but they have avoidable small problems during winters. First, they are hot, even if you configure the temperature for something colder. During winters, only the heater works. Air conditioner does not. So, your only choice is to lightly open the window in order to make the room a little bit colder. That is ok, but when you do that, you start listening the typical street noises because the street on which the hotel is is not so calm. Other avoidable small annoyance is that to use the safe you have to pay 2 euros a day. This was the only hotel in Europe having reasonable level that I saw that. 2 euros a day does not bankrupt you, but sounds unnecessarily unpleasant. It is also far from the main attractions. But this is not a real problem because there is a subway station two blocks away from the hotel and subway in Barcelona works very fine. Anyway, I would stay again at Pere IV without regrets. It is comfortable and associated with the nearby subway, it has a reasonable cost-benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Ingersoll
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a non-tourist neighborhood. It is about a block from the nearest subway station and about 40 minutes from the airport. There is a pool which was great for the kids. The rooms are relatively small but are fine. The service staff did a great job. The breakfast buffet is good. I really don't have any negatives. Overall a good quality hotel that was a good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel....very comfortable,clean room and excellant breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TillyTompkins
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day/3 night stay at this hotel with my teenage son and his friend. The room was very spacious and beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and every where was very clean. There was a very good choice at breakfast, to suit all tastes. We didn't try the spa but the boys did use the gym but apparently only 2 out of the 5 pieces of equipment worked!But ,hey, we didn't choose this hotel for it's gym facilities! Yes, the hotel is in a strange location but it was a very quiet street.There was another hotel opposite, a restaurant on the corner and a few cafes/bars dotted about. It was very convenient for the metro and 2 evenings we didn't return to the hotel until 8.30pm but felt quite safe walking back from the metro to the hotel. The receptionists all spoke good english and were very happy to help. Our only criticism was that you were unable to change the air conditioning in the room as it is set and our room was very hot. We had to sleep with our windows wide open so I would recommend you take a fan as we did struggle with the temerature in the room. Overall, for what we paid this hotel was certainly excellant value for money which I would happily return to and recommend. Tips: the metro was vey efficient and easy to use. I bought a 2 day ticket for the Bus Turistic on line from the company Viator which was cheaper and just handed in the voucher at the tuorist information at the airport. It came with maps and a book of discount vouchers which was very useful. Both evenings we ate at the steak house restaurant 'Mussol' (but at different loactions in the city) which again was good food and value for money. We felt quite safe walking around the city,it is a beautiful place and would def recommend Barcelona for a short city break. There was plenty to do and see for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location, and many little disappointments”
Reviews.Author: dgor82
Reviews.Content: 1. Very bad neighbourhood to walk at night, too far to walk to the interesting areas like Gothic and La Rambla 2. One factor in our choice for this Hotel was the fact that it has a SPA, but despite the great descriptions and photos, the facilities were a complete disappointment. We left the SPA area after only 15 min. The whirlpool was full of chlore-foam, the walls looked dirty and old, the Sauna was "out-of-order. (!) 3. Service: friendly but incompetent and unhelpful: Asked at the front-desk at 3am about possibilities to get ANY kind of food or snack,. The guy did NOT tell us then that there is a 24 hour vending machine with cookies, chips and drinks, which we found out the next day. That made us angry and I could have spared myself the taxi-ride to McDrive (about 10 min away)! 4. Other misc. complains: - Broken (loose) shower-head - Found a few hair in the bath-tub upon arrival - No toilet brush - No automatic daily "refill" of toilett paper - Horrible towels that feel like card-board and are blood stained - Old-fashioned, ugly interiors and furniture - Very thin walls and floors, the whole room is shaking frequently from someone slamming a door, we hear neighbours talk etc. - TV stands at an angle that it is virtually unusable from the bed Overall a nice and friendly place without the necessary attention to detail that you would expect from a 4-star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not to standard of 4* business hotel, use only if no better option”
Reviews.Author: TravelFanEU
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Feb 2010 and Feb 2011 for a major congress. Pere IV is in a shabby street and neighbourhood, seemingly surrounded by warehouses. It is 5 mins' walk to 2 metro stations with quick connection to tourist centre. In fact, I walked to tourist centre but it's a long walk (30 mins). There aren't many restaurants nearby but there is one very good restaurant about 5 mins' away (need to book) also in shabby street. The rooms are quite small and in some need of renovation with old fittings. In my room, there was hardly any water pressure in shower and the bathroom door did not open properly. When it did, it obstructed the WC. In my colleague's room it was too hot and there was no way to control the heating. The staff seem to be friendly but the service is off-hand and amateurish, giving impression of lack of training. On occasion, this gave the impression of discourtesy. Make sure breakfast is included. We paid €12.50/day for a very ordinary buffet. Overall, it's acceptable but it's not what I expect of a 4* business hotel at this price. Certainly poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GregKo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the location is not central but not that bad, 5 min from train station. Large and clean room, free soft drinks in the mini bar, lot of facilities in the hotel (gym, spa ...). Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Kev39
Reviews.Content: This hotel iseverything you expect frrom a 4 star hotel. Very clean and comfortable rooms and good service with a smile from all the staff. The area is mainly industrial but my wife and I walked everywhere and never felt any threat whatsoever. It is about 10 mins walk to the port, 10 mins to Sagrada Familia and 15 mins to Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “great value and great accessibility to sites”
Reviews.Author: skirtandsupersuit
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights at this hotel and were very satisfied. our room was clean and spacious. the decor is quirky, but still somewhat modern and pleasant. the location is not totally central, but the metro and various buses are so close that it made navigating the sites very convenient and easy. you can also take nice walks (about 20 - 30 mins) to both the old part of the city, as well as the beach and port olimpico from the hotel. the staff were very helpful in providing directions and guidance. the only negative was that one late night, there were people outside our room smoking and being loud which woke us, but i asked them to keep it down and they were apologetic and went back to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, very clean, friendly staff, ideally situated, very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: rivelynxo
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, the spa is excellent (despite the additional cost) and the hotel is only a short walk from the metro, and the city centre (Ramblas etc) is only one or two stops away. The area is not as pristine and smart as the rest of the city, but it is very safe to walk late at night, it appears to be an area that is not fully residential, however taxis are plentiful and bars / restaurants are within easy walking. La Sagrada Familia was the view from our window, how brilliant to wak up to that! The staff and reception were incredibly friendly, and the hotel is very smart and clean. We will definately stay here again when we visit in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Average Location, Great All Round Value”
Reviews.Author: Jamie959
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pere IV to attend 'el classico'. On booking with booking.com the price was £151 all in for 2 nights bed and breakfast in a double room. The room was very nice a huge bed, quite tasteful decor. Unfortunately the room didnt have adequate natural light as the window faced onto an annexe overlooking the roof of the spa so opening this window was noisy and faced onto all other rooms so there was no privacy. It had a pool and spa but it wasnt very big, worth having though! The LCD TV only had Spanish TV or a few German Channels, not ideal if youre English and fancy watching TV late in bed! The breakfast was very nice and had pretty much everything, the eggs were superb. The staff were extremely friendly and I had a few good conversations with them, most spoke good English. The area wasnt the best, for value for money it was ideal but it cost me 35 Euros for a taxi to the airport from the hotel (solo traveller with 1 case). There is a shopping centre 15 min walk in Diagonal and the marina beach is further on maybe 5/10 mins in a taxi. The close vicinity has some bars/cafes/commercial centres but the area seems quite run down but this is part of the local Barcelona. The metro is a 2 min walk so you can access anywhere, a single ticket was just over 1 euro. Overall I would recommend this hotel but I would prefer a hotel located more centrally closer to some more of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Around The world in 18 Days”
Reviews.Author: ralphfromTexas
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on line...The area was a bit seedy, however, the Hotel was very nice...Not luxurious, but clean and comfortable. It was close to a Metro station and I did walk (long) to a couple of sites. The Breakfast Buffet was very good. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT.”
Reviews.Author: funfoodsun
Reviews.Content: The reviews on tripadvisor are correct! This hotel is a gem, not too expensive for what you get. The spa is lovely although if it could open a little later would be icing on the cake! Closest station is Bogatell, which is a 2 minute walk away, if you walk quick. Close to the attractions and it wasn't a problem for us that we werent right in the city centre. Although we found that the travelcard wasn't really needed, everywhere is walkable distance and strolling through barcelona is wonderful on a sunny day! Instead we opted for the travel 10 times card, multi person use, worked out much cheaper too and was perfect for a day! =)

Reviews.Title: “Suited our Purposes”
Reviews.Author: RoyandGaynorJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected for us a part of package/deal and after reading mixed reports on Trip advisor did have one or two reservations - however - everything was fine for us. We were on a 4xnight (Sat to Tuesday) B&B Tariff and our trip was a revisit to do the sights in slow time since our last visit was a one day call off a Med cruise liner (whistle stop guided tour - crazy). We found the breakfast (Buffet) more than ample but rarely varied (beans on just one day was the only difference) - the service was slick and there was no queing either early 0700 or late 1000 - the Tea Bags werent to my liking but hey ho I didnt expect them to import English just for me !! - The Toasters were particularly slow but on the up side it was almost impossible to burn the slice(s). The cleanliness in the restaurant was very good with a new/clean table cloth for each new table setting. We found the double room adequate in size and quite comfortable - the bed whilst two singles pushed together wasnt a problem on the join. I never did discover whether the "complimentary" soft drinks/water in the mini fridge were actually free but I doubt it . For a 4* as advertised it would have been nice to have tea/coffe making facilities in the room - but we were made aware from previous reports that this was not on the list of facilities. To use the swimming pool required joining the spa entrance key charge at 8 Euro per day - since we were out and about till 2200 most days we did not partake - but yes you do need a swimming cap if you use it !! The nearest METRO Station is literally just round the corner and really is just 2/3 stops from a stepping stone to the centre. We thought it was good value and very easy to use once you get your head round the 5xlines interchanges. Once your down there you dont have to pay more than the one gate entry charge to complete your journey to any metro location. We found the most economic deal was a T10 ticket which is valid for a year from the date of purchase and permits 10 entrances onto the system (thus two people can share the one card @ approx 8 Euros). If your only using it to transit for walking tours that just a total of 4 entrances per day (there and back for two people). We were in Barcelona for 5 days purchased two T10s and finished with two unused which we donated to a happy traveller on our final return trip to the hotel to fly home. The baggage store was convenient on our last day (booked out by 1200 but didnt fly home until 2230) - no charge - locked and secure with tickets to reclaim - great. My hotel bill was the cheapest yet (just 20c for two tel calls - this to confirm tranfers etc) From this you will gather we ate out toatally save for breakfast (absolutely Paellaed out now). We didnt feel threatened walking in the area of the hotel at night (midnight even) - the whole of the adjacent street areas was more or less deserted of locals and minimal traffic. We wound our way back about 4/5 streets from a fairly good restaurant late one evening on foot and didnt see a soul. Oh just one tip - we didnt spot it until about day 3 - just outside the nearest Metro Station BAGATELLE or similarly spelt there is a water fountain similar to those dotted around variuosly in the City centre - handy for topping up your water bottle prior to getting on the Metro and lasts until you either choose to purchase fresh or top up again - we didnt suffer any tummy upset from partaking of these water supplies. If you are not in favour of this source then there are good chilled supplies in a cold coin/slot cabinet on floor one in the hotel - I never investigated the cost though. As I said - twas OK for us. Recommend the hop on hop off Blue and Red/Green open top bus system/routes with a two day ticket (29 euros each but you can get reductions down to 22 euros each and discount entrance fee booklets to other attractions by purhasing through the hotel) - We used it to get our bearings on day one and to create a must see list from the commentary(s) then worked our a round robin route for some of the more distant attractions on day 2 - therefater we were on foot closer into the centre and utilsed the Metro. Enough from me now Have a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and walking distance from main city centre attractions”
Reviews.Author: TimS21
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here and were very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the accommodation and how convenient it was for the main attractions, Placa de Catalunya, Ramblas, Sagrada Familia. Parking is available in the basement at 16 euros a night (though the ramp down to it is very steep and I'm glad I was not driving a large car). Restaurant good though a little pricey. Would definitely stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pere IV was a good choice for us.”
Reviews.Author: andrei_ro
Reviews.Content: The people from reception were very nice and helpfull, the room nice and clean, the services overall good and the breakfast was too good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Standrad Hotel for room rate”
Reviews.Author: ken101107
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. We booked through hotels.com and got an excellent room rate. The room ws of a very god size and the standard of cleanliness was excellent. The hotel was a 15 minute work tom the beach and 10 minute walk to a very good shopping center that conatined good value for money cafes, and a supermarket. . The Bogatel metro station was only a 5 minutes walk and the yellow line serves many of the majot attractions. We cannot give any comment on the food served by the hotel as we did not us the resteraunt. The bar area does offer good beer and snacks. The location does appear a little daunting but we did not experience any problems when walking back to the hotel in the early hours of the morning. If you can book a room at this hotel for £50 a night you have got a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lovely staff, convenient for city and international conference centre”
Reviews.Author: aHappyCustomer27
Reviews.Content: We were going to a conference at the CCIB and this hotel was very conveniently located about half way between the CCIB and the city centre on a metro line that ran to both (from Bogatell station on the L4 line). It was about a 25 minute walk to the CCIB, and 10 minutes to the sea front near Port Olympic where there were sandy beaches, cafes and restaurants. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The place was immaculately clean and my room (on the 8th floor) was very nice, with its own private balcony. It had the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in and the room was very quiet apart from the air conditioning (which I could switch off). I did not eat breakfast in the hotel, but the bar served a good range of drinks and the restaurant food was delicious, if perhaps a bit pricey. I did not try the pool. First impressions of the area around the hotel are not good - it looks rather salubrious, but it turned out that I never felt uncomfortable walking around the area on my own, even in the evening. There was virtually no traffic on the roads in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, watch out for the location”
Reviews.Author: chris8tine
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Pere IV. Interesting, slightly "out there" decor (reminded me vaguely of Alice in Wonderland) with plush red sofas, etc. The room was lovely. Huge, extra door between the sleeping area and the hallway so you weren't woken up at night. Good a/c, which was easy to regulate ourselves. And the windows were very well insulated -- I know this because occasionally we opened one when the weather wasn't too hot. But trust me, at night we kept them closed. The hotel is set out apart in what might be an "up-and-coming" residential area in Barcelona, but is currently a crazy nightlife scene. And not the type I would normally venture into as a clueless tourist. Even during the day, we occasionally ran across groups of people where my fiance and I decided we were better off crossing the street. At night, I wouldn't have ventured out alone and we made sure we avoided certain streets on the walk back. Had I been there as a woman alone, I think I would have had to check out and find another hotel, because otherwise I would essentially have been a prisoner in my hotel after sundown. Maybe it's the right location for a bachelor party? Not sure, but although the hotel was very nice, I wouldn't recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good prices, food and service!”
Reviews.Author: Mari850
Reviews.Content: I did some research on this hotel before I went and checked "tripadvisor" and I saw a lot of positive reviews and all were very accurate! The hotel was very nice and well put together. The staff was very very helpful. The rooms were nice and clean. The only problem was that it was very hot in our room, the A/C wasn't working on full power and the refrigerator was not working. Even with those problems, I still enjoyed the hotel stay. It was close to the subway (convient) in a big city and was more in a residential area, therefore it was away from the "hussle and bussle" of the city. The beach was walking distance, which was great! Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel but a bit out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireFruit
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfreind stayed here for 3 nights and it was one of the comfiest sleeps ever. The bed was two double beds pushed together so it was really big! There was a complimentary mini bar, not alcoholic though and there were only a few drinks and they don't top them up either but meh! The breakfast was awesome buffet with lots of pastries, bread and cheeses:D The only things is that it's quite a walk into town. To wall to port olympic it's about 15 mins down a looong road. Then from Port Olympic it's another 15-20 mins to port vell.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - friendly and helpful at all times - great food!”
Reviews.Author: chocolatebutton
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day break at the Pere iv on a B&B basis - the good points: really helpful and friendly staff fluent in English and did everything they could do answer questions and help out when needed. The food at breakfast was fantastic, really fresh and constantly topped up, there was something there to suit any tastes and was a great start to the day! The pool and spa was also great and refreshing after a days sightseeing! It was also easy to reach 2 metro stations which made geting around easy! The downside is the area - there is nothing else around really that youd want to go to eat or drink so you would have to taxi or metro to go out, we didnt feel unsafe at any point but maybe late at night it may feel different! The room was clean and comfortable and we were upgraded to a better room as it was my partners birthday! All in all we'd recommend the hotel and would stay in again - just wish you could pick it up and move it a little more accessable to a local choice of eateries! Another plus is that it is within walking distance of the main bus station where you will be dropped off if catching the Barcelona Bus if flying in to Gerona!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkypud
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel as it included breakfast in the price and other hotels in the area were charging breakfast seperately. friendly staff, reception were very helpful. the room was was well decor, flat screen tv, ....who watches tv on holiday,except no' BBC world' would have been nice. the bathroom was fine, the shower head kept slipping down theattaced chrome pole, so we wedge it with the shower foam can !!! Breakfast was great, good selection of hot and cold buffet, nice coffee, dare we say we went up a few times , too fuel us for all the walking we did around town. Good measures at the hotel bar for a nightcap after sampling the good resturants on the seafront, which is by the way only 10-15 min walk from hotel. dont be put off of the location of the hotel,its not the Rambles,but it was quite and a few grocery stores dotted about and the odd bar. remember to take a shower cap, they wont let you in the pool without one. The pool is quite small, but had mini spa and a small gym....but heywe were there for the food and wine not a work out!!!! hope this helps. Gary & John

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jetlag83
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at the hotel and got a great room with a large terrace and lots of sun in the evening. Pros: - Very nice staff - Close to public transport - Rooms in 8th floor have large terraces (i was lucky to get such a room) - Good house wine with nice price (€ 9,- per bottle) - Good breakfast - Free WiFi in rooms (Had to ask reception for the key) Cons: - Surrounded by small bars (not visible at day time, opened around midnight), what can be noisy especially on weekends - Room maids turn off AC after cleaning - Safe deposit boxes are charged extra All together very recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: willieScotland
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our third viist to this hotel. Although our last was 4 years ago we were given an upgrade to a top floor suite with 2 rooms, bathroom with large jacuzzi and large balcony with a sea glimpse. To be fair the view is mainly of the surrounding commercial area but it was somewhere nice to sit in the morning. There is also a fridge and tea and coffee making facilities, however there is a charge for refilling the coffee facilities after your first day. Better to pack some of your favoiurite coffee and buy a carton of milk which you can keep in the fridge. We were room only basis so it was handy to have a cuppa before we went out in the morning. The coffee in the dining room is disgusting anyway, or should I say, not quite to our taste!! The room was spotlessly clean and the sheets and towels changed regularly. The staff were all extermely friendly and helpful. Some people have complained about the location. If you ignore the grafitti, which is a common site throughout Barcelona it's fine. It's very quiet at night but there is a bit of building work going on around so can be a bit noisy during the day. Less than a minute away is Bogatell metro station and you can be at the edge of the El Gotico district in less than 8 minutes. from there it's a short walk along Ave jaume 1 to La Ramblas. Less than 15 minutes walk takes you to the beach and Port Olimpico with its large selection of bars and restaurants and wonderful Marina. from there you can walk along the sea front to Port Vell and El Born districts in about 30 minutes. All in all for 316 euros for a 5 night stay you can't beat it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: zanaboby
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel not far from the port and the Barceloneta, with wide rooms and non-smoking floors. Continental breakfast (buffet) available, spa and training room. The nearby metro station is a good way to start visiting the city; with a short walk you can reach the Sagrada Familia cathedral. The surroundings are not as nice as the hotel, but in any case quite and clean. A special thanks to the reception, that offered us a welcome wine tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel - clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: CostaBlancaTripper
Reviews.Content: Rooms spacious, comfy and clean. Bathroom, a little tired though everything worked as it should. My main criticism of the bedroom was that the lights (these wonderful low energy bulbs that seem to be everywhere now) did not give off enough light to be able to read comfortably. The other problem was the temperature; so hot in the room and the air-con was very inefficient. All staff we spoke to were friendly and efficient with the exception of the bar. We went to the bar lunchtime on the day we arrived for our 4 day stay. We were the only people at the bar and I ordered a bottle of beer and a Bacardi & coke. She got both drinks wrong and then changed the TV channel from the English speaking one it had been on when we arrived to a Catalan station and then she disappeared! Disinterested and rude to boot. We never went to the bar again. The swimming pool is tiny - more of a plunge pool. The hotel says it has great views across the city - not from the 4th floor it doesn't! All we saw was a back street and a building that looked as if it was made from corrugated iron. The food is nothing special and very expensive for what it is. There is a small bakery/cafe just at the back of the hotel where 4 of us had excellent breakfasts for the price that the hotel charges for 1. The general area is a bit run down and seedy, but no real problem. Metro station is close nearby. If all you want is a clean & comfortable place to sleep at a reasonable price, you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: G00dman
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel. Friendly staff. Large room. mini-bar with free drinks. Swimming pool. The breakfast was good. Area around the hotel isnt the best but close to the metro - 5 minutes walk to Bogatell station (yellow line). Get to the center by metro – about 20 minutes, 10 minutes by taxi (cost 7 euro to Plaza Catalunya). Fully deserving of its 4 stars. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: lonely_pigeon
Reviews.Content: We booked the Pere IV through a special offer in the newspaper (with Driveline holidays), and so were not entirely sure what to expect. However, having read some good reviews on this site, we were hopeful...and we weren't disappointed! Admittedly the area is not the most picturesque, but we never felt unsafe walking back from the metro at night (the nearest station is Bogatell, about 5mins walk away). It is an industrial type area, which just meant that it was quiet at night and there was quite a bit of building work going on during the day. It is on the edge of town, but the metro is very convenient and inexpensive (with aircon!), and you can walk to the park area (Parc de la Cuitadella) within about 10-15minutes, and beyond that to the old town within about 20-25minutes if you're a fan of walking. The hotel itself is lovely. The decor was a bit over the top colour-wise (with bright yellow, green and red in the reception and bar), but had been done to a high standard and was very clean. We checked in early, so our room wasn't ready, but we were able to leave our bags in the secure storage area and head out to begin exploring Barcelona. When we checked in later, we found we had been given one of the largest rooms (according to the fire escape floorplan), which also had a balcony - try to get a room on the eighth floor for that, there are lifts! The room was decorated more tastefully, in black and white with green accents, with a lovely marble bathroom. It was all spotlessly clean and tidy, and had aircon. The hotel also has free wi-fi, which we had no trouble accessing. The breakfast was good, it consisted of a large continental-style self-service buffet, including cereals, meats and cheeses, pastries, toast, egg and bacon, fruit, yogurt, juices, tea and coffee...something for everyone! It was kept well stocked, even when we went down for breakfast towards the end of the session (7-10am). We never used the restaurant, but the menu sounded appetising, if a little expensive (though having said that, with the poor exchange rate against the £, all of Barcelona worked out to be a little expensive!). We used the swimming pool a couple of times, it wasn't the biggest but it was never busy and we saw it as a bonus rather than something we "needed" out of the holiday. There was also a jacuzzi, steam room, sauna and small gym (though we didn't use it...too much like hard work when you're on holiday!). All these facilities were clean and well kept. there were also lockers to keep your keys/towels etc in. We got one lovely surprise from the hotel - it was my birthday during our stay, and presumably the maid saw my cards and someone checked my passport, as that evening room service brought up a small bottle of champagne and a card, compliments of the staff! It was a lovely touch that made our stay even more special. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely use this hotel again. We really couldn't fault it, we had a brilliant time in Barcelona, due in no small part to the excellent service we received at the Pere IV.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, scary neighberhood, and over charging for little things”
Reviews.Author: jook84
Reviews.Content: when searching for hotels- we wanted a place that is close to the main attractions, with an easy access and that we could relax at. Although the hotel was really easy to get to(don't be tempted to cross the bridge), the location itself was kind of scary- it seems as if it is in the middle of an industry area. the hotel itself was good, very clean and nice staff, but the pool area with the sauna cost 8 Euros a day, which is definitely not worth it. the pool is small and ugly. When we asked for a kettle, they told us we would be charged 6 Euros a day, which is definitely not worth it. we found a place in the city that sold a kettle for 6 Euros! in addition the mini bar was free- but all it contained was 2 mini water bottles, coca cola and Schweppes . but overall it was ok, as long you you kow what youre getting yourself into and dont go there for leisure purposes. i guess we could have gone to a 3 stars hotel for cheaper and end up using exactly the same utilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,Friendly and Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Nikki00280
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited my boyfriend and myself down to the ground. The decor is cooky and quaint,the staff are helpfull,knowledgeable and fluent. We found it a little difficult to locate from the Metro the first time (as it is not on the same road,but rather left-right-left-right! and very poorly signposted.) The area is not the best,but clearly a residential area and we did not feel threatend walking back at night. The rooms are spacious and well appointed,and free drinks in the mini-bar were a nice touch. We were shocked that we were expected to pay 8 euro each per day for the spa/pool,but as we had pre-paid they kindly allowed us to use it for free, and the spa is lovely. The breakfast is nice,but overpriced. The promixity to the metro is excellent,i would recommend a Barcelona Card (unlimited travel and discounts) to use this efficeint way of travelling all over the city. Overall this hotel was excellent,fully deserving of its 4 stars and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: caloomba
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights when I was attending a wedding just outside of Barcelona. The staff were very helpful when I needed any assistance and, in general, they were always polite, cheerful and courteous even when our group ended up being quite demanding and indecisive! The decor wasn't to my taste, however, it was freshly decorated and the entire hotel was very clean. The room was a reasonable size, flat-screen TV and free soft-drinks in the minibar...the bathroom was spotless and towels etc were ok. I only made it to breakfast one morning but it was good food and plenty of choice of hot and cold food. I did find the hotel quite difficult to find from the metro but, then again, I do get lost quite easily...would be no problem to find in a taxi I would think! Overall, I enjoyed my stay here and if I return to Barcelona I will book here if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms, lovely breakfast just not the best location”
Reviews.Author: c_foulk
Reviews.Content: 9 of us stayed here for my hen weekend. We were al little worried when we arrived as the hotel is in quite a run-down area of the city. The lobby is quite a garish mix of red and green but as soon as we ascended the staircase this things seemed to look better. The rooms are absolutely beautiful - we were amazed. The decor in each room was very tasteful with lovely furniture, a sitting area and a beautiful big bathroom. There were even complimentary soft drinks in the mini bar. The breakfast is a large buffet with a wide variety of items on offer. There is lots of fruit, cereal, baked goods and even enough to make yourself an English breakfast (of sorts). Like I say, the location is quite a sticking point but if you're prepared to jump on the metro line/in a taxi then it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “If wanting to see sites of Barcelona not the right location.”
Reviews.Author: Mtzi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely not 4 star. Rooms are very small, bland with terrible decor. The worst part is the location, in a heavy industrial area and not somewhere to walk at night, even from the metro station. A warehouse disco situated very close by and noisy at night. Hotel is just in the wrong area if you want to explore Barcelona and its wonderful sites. Only good thing, breakfast was good in hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but in a downmarket area of the city”
Reviews.Author: Graham B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel and were very impressed. For the price paid it was pretty good value. The room was large and well maintained, although so warm that we had to sleep with the window open (in February!). There's a small fridge with free soft drinks. If you want a kettle it's €6 per day, but the bar serves excellent coffee for much less. The leisure facilites consist of a small swimming pool (too small for proper swimming, but very warm and ideal for relaxing under the high pressure jets), a sauna, steam room and various varieties of shower. There is no changing area though, so you have to go to and from your room in swimwear. The area in which the hotel is located is run down, but apparently has been earmarked for gentrification. It felt safe enough though, even at night. And it's very close to the Bogatell Metro station, from where it's only 3 stops to the old town, and the trains are clean and efficient. Beware of the smell near the Metro station entrance though! I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star at most”
Reviews.Author: PilarBravo
Reviews.Content: I was in Pere IV hotel during a business travel. The room decoration is the ugliest I've ever seen, and the single room size is not suitable for claustrophobic people. The room temperature was extremely hot, even in winter. Nice bathroom kit and free minibar, but definitely it's not a 4 star hotel. The only good thing I found was the big terrace. The TV was placed in such way it was impossible to use from the bed. I paid a reduced price due to a special offer, but in normal situation it doesn't worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not a nice area”
Reviews.Author: Claire024
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights with my mum and sister. We booked a triple room and got a double bed, a sofa bed and a pull out bed. It was a huge room, we had plenty of space. I found the decor unique, it was pleasant. The reception staff were always friendly to us and we didnt have any problems with them. You have to pay for a kettle in your room if you want tea/coffee, that was $6 a day. I would recommend this hotel. Its not too expensive, and its within easy walking distance to Bogatell metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Willow”
Reviews.Author: fizz26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the beginning of the month, had planned to stay for the week...... The decor was from the 70's. the swimming pool was the size of a large bath and the food in the restaurant was, where do I start....... way over the priced and discusting!!!! Would I stay here again?........ NO! Would I reccommend this hotel? NO

Reviews.Title: “Unfair”
Reviews.Author: kirkfishface
Reviews.Content: Due to loss of my credit card on holiday, I could not show the card used for payment of the room. The staff were very unhelpful, and proceeded to charge for the room but refused to let us stay despite proof of ID. Waste of £73. We had to make our way to the airpost and stay there for the evening as it was too late to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: AnnieTum
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law booked this hotel for us - we all travelled from Ireland for a holiday in Spain. The location was pretty good, although I would have preferred to be closer to the city center. The rooms were clean and pretty spacious. Bathrooms were nice. A/C could have been better - the main vent was right inside the door and you could feel the cool air, but it didn't seem to disperse into the rest of the room. Barcelona in July is pretty hot! But the front desk staff were fantastic. We had booked 3 rooms and one of them reeked of smoke (we hadn't specified a non-smoking room on the reservation). Heric at the front desk literally took us around to several other rooms until we found 3 together that suited us - he couldn't have been more helpful! And another nice touch - the mini fridges in the rooms were complementary!

Reviews.Title: “Pere IV upgrade great!”
Reviews.Author: Firhouse
Reviews.Content: A bit challenging to find once we left the underground, but v.glam when we found it. They had put us into a twin room when we had booked a double, and got moved to their only remaining double room suite on the top floor that was huge and had a large terrace - absolutely fabulous. Room Service was very expensive and not particularly great. The health spa was small with a poky sauna, minimal fitness equipment and the swimming pool a little too small for a proper swim, but there was no one in it and this was good fun. Staff lovely and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “dated and grubby”
Reviews.Author: mrsmcmoyne
Reviews.Content: The staff are very nice but the place is very grubby and old fashioned. The towels are like cardboard! The area is not nice, a bit industrial..... Would not stay there again. More like a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but poor area”
Reviews.Author: Ritanbob
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights after a cruise on Med. Hotel was clean, the room comfortable. The reception staff were excellent providing a town map on arrival pointing out places of interest. Although a bit out of the main town it is very handy for a Metro station which is on a direct line to the main places of interest. Our room was large, well furnished and comfortable. Cant pass judgement on the restaurant as we did not use it finding that the meals were expensive and there are plenty of eating places in town. Would recommend it. The surrounding area looks rough but we felt quite comfortable walking back and forward to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: spennys
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Very clean and tidy. we walked to the hotel from the centre on arrival and it took about an hour (did not realise there was a metro (marina) near). Bar shuts at 12.30 but a pub/club next right next door, looks rubbish but was ok and open till 3am. good for a break with the wife/girlfriend, just bring comfortable shoes. We walked for miles-but it was worth it. Reception could not do enough - they got us tickets for the Barcelona game and booked us in to a nice restaurant (4cats) probably the best reataurant in Barca, not cheap but food A1. Just dont get too drunk and fall over in reception because the lamp stands work out at £200. as we found out! hello Marty and Babs. S & B.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - would be happy to stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: BournemouthKath
Reviews.Content: We spent a pre Xmas family weekend at Pere IV and had a fantastic time! We had two adjoining rooms as requested and were very impressed by the size and overall quality of each. The staff were extremely polite and helpful and spoke excellent English- which helped us enormously. We arrived fairly late on the Friday night and just managed to get a table in the restaurant before it closed. We then asked the helpful waiters if 3 of us could have vegetarian meals! ( the menu was typically Spanish with lots of hearty meat dishes!). Although there was absolutely nothing suitable on the menu, a delicious 3 course meal was soon rustled up - Artichoke soup with fresh olive bread, followed by a mixture of roasted Mediterranean veg- including fresh asparagus and artichokes!! The meat eaters in the family enjoyed their meals too and all the portions were huge. Breakfast was also very impressive - we all particularly enjoyed the tortillas. We didn't use the pool or gym area- simply because we didn't have time. We did however go to look at the pool and although small it looked very attractive. The Pere IV is not as central as some other hotels but we walked to the Sagrada Familia in less than 30 minutes. A taxi from the centre of town cost us 6 euros - so cheap that we didn't even try the underground. We would be more than happy to stay in this hotel again - and look forward to the next time.

Reviews.Title: “How did this place ever get 4 stars?!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaB_1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in lots of 4 star hotels around the world and have stayed in other 4 star hotels in Barcelona and by comparison the Pere IV is terrible. It was booked for me as I am on a business trip. Last night and this morning I barely slept at all because it was so noisy. The floors in the rooms are not carpeted and because it is an old hotel there is little or no sound proofing between the floors and as a result when someone walks across the room above you it sounds like thunder and if someone drops something your room practically shakes. There is also no sound proofing between rooms and I was woken up in the morning by the room next door playing dance music. Whilst I did stay on a Saturday night the noise I experienced cannot be attributed to the day of the week because I was disturbed by the kind of everyday noises of people moving around. The rooms are very small, the bed covers are not nice and the complimentary soaps etc are cheap. Our room looks out into an internal atrium so has no view. I suspect 50% of the rooms share this outlook. As well as having no view, the atrium is very noisy because any noise in it echoes and bounces off all four walls. Nothing is what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The decor is horrible despite what other reviewers have said. Who in their right mind would paint the walls orange and fit a red carpet? It is very dated. Furthermore, the area is not pleasant at all. It is surrounded by mechanics garages and similar businesses. There is nothing nearby of any interest and the area feels dirty and not particularly safe. The only benefit of the location is it's proximity to Razzmatazz night club! It is a good 20 minute walk to the centre. I suspect this hotel has received it's 4 star rating for some reason like the fact it has a swimming pool and a large reception and restaurant. It certainly isn't because the rooms and area are nice. You will not have a 4 star holiday if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It's not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: Doneit49
Reviews.Content: From the outside you get a feeling of shabbiness and uninviting, but once you get through the door, you will find a brightly decorated reception with very friendly and helpful staff to help you. Once we were checked in, and pointed in the direction of our rooms, it was a different feeling. Yes the décor is a bit dated, but the rooms were clean and for the amount of time that we planned to stay in our rooms, it didn’t discourage us in any way. We had no view at all from the room that we had, just looking at a blue mosaic wall that looked straight into other guests rooms. Complimentary soft drinks were left in the refrigerator, and this was nice after our journey, these were replenished every day. The area around the hotel, is a bit run down, with lots of road works going on but we could not hear any of this in our room. A 20 minutes walk will take you to the sea front and marina at Port Olympic, here you’ll find lots of bars and restaurants, but be warned, down by the marina you’ll pay top price and there’s not a lot on the plate, so go a little in land for a better deal. We found the shopping mall just off the front has some very good places to eat at a more reasonable price. If you don’t want to stray too far from the hotel, I can recommend Xiscarexantar restaurant, which is: when you come out of the hotel, turn left, then left again just a 2 minutes walk. Good food at a great price. The breakfast in the hotel was fine, with a good variety on offer each morning, take your sunglasses, as the dinning room is again very brightly painted. You will find bright colours everywhere you go in Barcelona, not only in the Pere IV. This I found out later, is the Gaudi influence. The Bus Turistic is a good way to get around and see the city and get your bearings a 2 day pass will cost you 23 euros, but well worth it. The Sagrada Familia is a must see for everyone, so too is the Nou Camp Stadium even if you’re not a football fan, you will love this tour. Walk around at your own pace, no one rushes you, sit in the stand and soak up the atmosphere. And at 11 euros it’s a steal. Walk around in Barri, the Gothic area of Barcelona, and take in some of the most fantastic architecture, and not forgetting the Rambla for the street entertainers. We had 5 days in Barcelona, and I can say we had a great time. Yes the hotel is a bit dated, but it’s clean, and the staff are friendly. So don’t believe everything that others have wrote about this hotel, go with your own instincts like we did, and have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: planetbollox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for an autumn city break, we got our flights with Ryan air and used superbreak for booking the hotel. We simply looked at what superbreak could offer and the price was very good for a four star hotel. The hotel is out of the main area but not actually that far. City breaks are all about walking exploring etc. This hotel is about 15 - 20 mins walk from the Arc de Triomphe (yes, Barcelona style) and this marks the beginning of the Gothic quarter. The rooms are of an excellent size with huge beds ! There are soft drinks in the fridge, I think these are actually freebies but cannot be certain. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant but did have breakfast everyday which is of a good standard and substantial. The staff are all very polte and helpful. Here is a good tip that is definitely worth a try. On the same block as the hotel but diagonally opposite is a small bar cum restaurant. One night we had a three course (set) meal, 2 bottles of wine, 3 coffees (I had an extra) a brandy and a tia maria - no optics ! - all for 32 euros ! Absolute steal ! On passeig St Joan de Borbo is what is probably the best sea food restaurant in Barcelona, El Rey de Gamba. Their paella is superb, we had that but the locals were having simply massive seafood platters - they were immense ! Back to the hotel, perhaps it isn't in the most aesthetically pleasing of areas but it ain't faf from town and if it was any closer it would be more expensive - swings and roundabouts ! We walked everywhere to and from this hotel over four days with no problems whatsoever. If you are in town for a few days, the bus touristica is worth using as a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: diabel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a city trip to Barcelona (during which we were visiting a friend studying there in the Erasmus exchange program). We booked this hotel because it was a bit out of the tourist area and therefore as expensive as a 3 starred hotel in the tourist area. We arrived by plane and took the train/subway shuttle to the city centre, where we changed onto the right subway line to the hotel. The hotel was quite close to the subway station. As a matter of fact you can even easily walk from the city centre to the hotel. The only minor point is that it's not in a really nice neighbourhoud, though we never thought is was not safe to walk there in the night. The rooms were splendid, as is all the interior of the hotel. Also the breakfast is just great. Can't give any remarks about these. Also the staff was very great and helpful. After all we thought it was a good choice to stay here in stead of the city centre, because we ended up paying about the same amount, being close to the city centre, but having way more comfort.

Reviews.Title: “nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: eilisnimhidhe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 other girlfriends.
