The hotel is oddly decorated which is very amusing. the staff were very polite and helpful. the hotel location is an odd one. its 15 min walk to the beach and a 5 minute taxi ride to the main centre of Barcelona. the surrounding area of the hotel seems a bit run down although we always felt safe there walking home at all hours. I would recommend this hotel. the only negative is that the rooms werent very airy and our window looked directly into other hotel rooms. if you are just going to use as a base then its a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mixed!”
Reviews.Author: marko1878
Reviews.Content: The area around the hotel is horrible, with one of the worst stenches ever encountered, eminating from heaven knows where but heading straight for you nostrils! The Hotel itself is fairly comfortable, with a decent sized room (by Spanish standards), and a good bathroom. The Breakfast was fine but I wouldn't have paid for it had it not been included in the price (it was about £8-00). The pool area is indoors and is very small with an even smaller jacuzzi and a small gym. The bar was OK, and reasonably priced, but you cannot say that for the rest of Barcelona! What a rip off! We last went to Barca in 2004 and had a wonderful time,but we will be giving it a very wide berth in the future. We stayed 2 nights prior to joining a cruise but wouldn't do so again. It is located outside of the main areas (Las Ramblas etc) but is very easily reached via the metro. (Marina) which is left out of the hotel up four blocks (holding your nose) and turn right 100yds. A visit to Barcelona Football Club was excellent. Don't be conned into buying a ticket for the interactive show (unless you want to!) The stadium tour and museum is 11 euro (joint ticket) and the interactive is 29. Ramblas is a hive of activity but please watch you don't get ripped off for drinks. Ask for the menu before choosing your drink so as not to be caught out! It's a great place to people watch but look out for the naturist who strolls up and down, having painted swimming trunks around HIS bits! The hotel is so-so, the area is the pits, Barcelona is a rip off. Not a place I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LenaPerth
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night for 2 nights and were surprised to hear we were upgraded to a balcony suite! This made our stay excellent value for money. I don't know what the standard room was like, but our 9th floor room was superb. The room was quiet during the mid-week (I read a review which said it gets noisy on a Friday night) and very clean. The breakfast was good, but not what we Australians are used to! And yes, the soft drinks and water in the bar fridge is complimentary, so drink up! We had dinner in the restaurant on our second night and ordered the set menu which is great value. They even have a kids menu which was very affordable, with icecream included! If you order a'la carte, be prepared to pay a lot more. My husband and I had the best dinner of all our 26 dinners in Europe! Excellent presentation, food cooked to perfection and the service was superb! The waiter even wanted to spoonfeed our 3 year old who didn't really need much coaxing to eat spaghetti bolognaise! We had a great time with both waiters and wished we could eat there again the next night! Finally, whenever we asked for assistance, it was given with generosity and genuine warmth! (Something rare these days! ) I was given a map and very good directions to catch a bus or train to the city only 5-10 minutes away! I wanted to know what time the bus left for the airport to catch my Ryanair flight to Paris and within 2 minutes I had the answer and the taxi booked to take us to the bus station! If in Barcelona, this is the place! Oh, did I mention cheap bar prices at the bar in the foyer? (No wonder everyone was in the bar drinking!)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: V-Gilmour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely - very clean and bright with excellent staff. Bedrooms are large and spacious, decor unique and fresh... Breakfast is of a high standard with lots of choice. Area around the hotel a little run down with few amenities, but it is only 15 mins walk to Port Olympic. Surrounding area is very safe and taxi's are cheap into the centre. Would definately recommend this hotel to all visiting Barcelona and would stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel just outside the city”
Reviews.Author: Wrightsky
Reviews.Content: My Sister-in-Law booked this for her 40th Birthday weekend and there were 7 of us. We really enjoyed staying at this hotel, it was bright, clean and the staff were very very helpful. The rooms were spotless and had a fridge in with free soft drinks in which were replenished daily. The only downside is the location. Firstly, the address is not Avda Pere IV 69, this is the back of the hotel which doesn't have any signs outside. The Front of the hotel is 128-130 Carrer de Pallars. This caused a bit of confusion with our transfer from Girona airport and the taxi drivers had not heard of the hotel when trying to get back at night but I had the correct address written down so that helped. I imagine if you are trying to find it in a Hire Car it might cause problems because of the one way streets. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing out over the back of the hotel which has 3/4 late night bars with revellers spilling out into the street on Friday and Saturday nights. However with the window shut you could hardly hear them and there is air conditioning in the room. If you really find it a problem the rooms on the other side of the corridor face out over the middle of the hotel overlooking the swimming pool. Sunday night was quiet. There are no other hotels around, it is mainly warehouses and flats. Didn't see many people walking about but we never felt unsafe, but there were 7 of us, I suppose. There is the Bogatell Metro station 2 blocks away and this can take you to the port where the casino and late night bars and restaurants are or further on to Placa De Catalunya. We walked back from the port a couple of times and it took us 12/15 mins. Taxi's were costing approx 4 euros to the port or 5/6 euros to Catalunya square. Breakfast was 12 Euros and will not please the English who like a big english breakfast. However, there were lots of fruit, juices, breads, cakes, cereals, yoghurts, cheeses and meats as well as tea and coffee. I had a breakfast every morning but most of my party waited till we got into town and had a brunch. Would I stay there again, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - gem!”
Reviews.Author: lizmck
Reviews.Content: I struggled to get accommodation for our wedding anniversary as it clashed with the Spanish Grand Prix. I found the Pere IV on one of my many trawls, so was a bit suspicious that they still had availability. What a lucky girl I am! The receptionist gave us the 'most romantic room' - a lovely 9th floor room with a terrace and a complimentary bottle of beautiful cava to help us celebrate our anniversary. The staff could not not have been more helpful and kind, willing to give advice on sights, restaurants, bars etc. Having a pool, jacuzzi and sauna was great after a days sightseeing, although the pool was a wee bit cool! The only downside was that it was a 10 min walk to get to the main tourist areas, although taxis are plentiful and fairly cheap and there is a metro station round the corner. An extremely good value for money hotel which we would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but Not worth the money: thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: aggy81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice however it is definitly not 4 star. Yes it has a pool and yes it has many of the ammenities of a 4 star hotel however some things are lacking. Negatives: For a start the hotel only has 2 lifts - a real problem in the morning when everyone is trying to leave the hotel/go down to breakfast at once. The mini bar in the hotel is sparce - not much there. There is no pay per view TV or many non spanish channels. The area around the hotel is not great. Lastly and most importantly the walls and doors are very thin. This is a real problem as you can hear everything in the room next door and people talking as they walk past your room. This was a real issue for us as we had the familly from hell living nexty door. It really did sound like they were running and jumping around the room all morning and day, shouting and moving furniture around. For a 4 star hotel I would not expect this. Now for the few positives: it has a pool, it is near the metro, the beds are quite comfortable. I would not stay in this hotel - you can stay somewhere much nicer for the same or even less money and nearer to the town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Would come again”
Reviews.Author: QueenslandSummer
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for 4 days. I found the hotel to be quite pleasant overall. The reception staff were very nice, always happy to help and spoke good english. The single room I stayed in was comfortable, although the walls seemed quite thin. It costs extra to have tea/coffee and kettle in your room - something I'm used to having included in your room. The meal I had at the restaurant was delicious. The breakfast was okay - lots to choose from, mostly cold stuff. Being an Aussie, I would have liked some bacon and eggs. The location of the hotel was not bad, a bit industrial though, and as a young female, travelling alone, I did not feel safe venturing more than about 20m from the hotel entrance. If I wasn't alone, I think it would have been okay and I'd definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: beniboi
Reviews.Content: this hotel was rather nice i must say! the location for starters was a bit...crap i sopose. the area is basicly warehouses and not so nice flats... bt then we got into the hotel and it was very good. its pretty modern (90's) and the rooms were very big, if very brigtly coulered. we got a very good view from our room ( onto the hills were there was a forest fire when we looked....) and the minibar was free with drinks to keep you happy. breakfast was good, has an excellent choice of cold buffet but not much hot stuff, and bein british i do love a good cooked breakfast but there was enough to keep me going. as for getting into town, the metro is literly a minute away on line 4, and was about 3 stops from the city centre. personally i didnt have any trouble on the metro... maybe cause i'm 6ft3 they keep out my way? i dunno but its safe enough. so overall good hotel and deffently consider staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricJoseph
Reviews.Content: Less than half the price of comparable hotels on or near Las Ramblas. The 'catch' is the not exactly 'upmarket' area. Why build such a good hotel here? Turn right outside the hotel and a few minutes walk brings you to a business development area, but most of the guests are tourists. Don't let the neighbourhood put you off and save a fortune. The Metro is just a few minutes walk. Trains are very frequent and only a few stops and about 10 minutes from the centre. Barceloneta is two stops and 5 minutes for the harbour, restaurants and the surprisingly interesting Catalan Museum. Hotel decor a bit odd, but it works. Rooms are roomy and well appointed, especially the bathroom. Staff very helpful. Breakfast good, dinner also good value, although menu a little limited.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel with one exception”
Reviews.Author: iwant2cworld
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, only a few stops from Ramblas, so worth paying the reduced rate compared to more central hotels. Excellent breakfast, was 12 euro pp, not included in our hotel rate. Staff went out of their way to accomodate our 1 year old baby, arranged a cot in bedroom. Negatives were that even though we went in winter, rooms were hot and this was without any heating on, we had to switch on the aircon to cool our room. Our room was facing a road with all the bars on, and it was very noisy. This seems to be a problem on Saturday nights only when they open until 5am. Music, cars and people all contributed to this noise. So request a room at the front of the hotel if you a light sleeper. Overall, recommended but request a room at the front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: aine44
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is magic. Myself and 2 friends have returned from a 5 day stay in this hotel . It has been a great experience and I cannot praise the hotel staff highly enough. They were most welcoming when we arrived and all during our stay they made very welcome suggestions as to where to eat or where to visit. We asked for a quiet room which we got. Our room did not have an outside window as it opened on to a roofed courtyard and did at times get very warm ( In Ireland we are used to the cold in January!!) When we mentioned this we were offered another room . Breakfast was excellent. The Hotel itself is very clean, cheerful and colourful . I would stay there again. The area the hotel sits in is not the most attractive which would be the only drawback of an exceptionally pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. No problem with the neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: jsk-sg
Reviews.Content: We had a small room in the centre of the building but this was very quiet. After flying into Girona we got the bus into Barcelona & the hotel was easy to find. It was very late at night but we didn't feel intimidated 'though we walked past a few very 'interesting' night clubs & bars. The rooms at the hotel were spotlessly clean. Complimentary soap, shower/bath gel & toothbrushes were replenished on a daily basis. The reception & bar staff were extremely helpful & the breakfasts were more than we needed to keep us going through long sightseeing days. We ate in the restaurant & bar & both were excellent value for money. If we go back to Barcelona we will go back in December for the Christmas Market outside the Cathedral & the street entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice hotel in smelly, untidy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Hrundl
Reviews.Content: Good points Our room was great: polished floors, marble bathroom, safe, minibar, comfy bed, quiet air conditioning. The shower worked well and there was always lots of hot water and the water system was very quiet at night. The breakfast is very good: meats, cereal, breads, cakes and many drinks - eat as much as you like. The staff are very friendly and will speak english, if required. You can leave your suitcase(s) at the hotel in a locked room free of charge if you have a late flight. The is a metro nearby with very good access to all the sites of Barcelona. Bad points First of all, for its star rating, there are no bad points to the hotel: it's truly a great hotel. However, the area around the hotel is very unkempt and smells bad (I'm guessing it's the sewage system). On Friday, you can look forward (???) to the street party 3 - 7 am, yes AM, where the local hooligans play loud music, dance and sing songs for your pleasure...hmmm. Perhaps they'll let you join in. I am not sure how safe the streets are but nothing happened to us and we walked from the metro to the hotel late each night, It's not really that bad...just a bit smelly. Warning: The main cathedral is currently under cover as it is being repaired. Also, the cable cars are out of action. Worth seeing: Sagrada Familia...a newish cathedral that is still being built. The zoological park in the SE...nice zoo. The fortress on top of the hill to the West. Good restaurants The Attic on the Rambla (£40 for 3-course meal for two) Egypt on the Rambla (£16 for 3-course meal for two inc wine) Taxi to airport is 30 Euros Taxi to city centre is about 6 Euros...USE IT and you'll have a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mags200
Reviews.Content: Ive just returned from a 4 day break in this hotel. The hotel was great, the service from I checked in until I checked out was brillant and the staff couldn't have been more helpfull. Dave on the reception was great giving me lots of tourist information from what to see to where to eat and warnings about pickpockets. I had e-mailed the hotel before I arrived to get information on getting from Sants bus station to the hotel and they got back to me quite quickly. The facilities in the hotel was excellent, the pool and gym area was abit small but there wasnt many guests using them so it was ok. My room was lovely, the bathroom was quite spacious, the bedroom was on the small side but it was a single room and there was a balcony with a table and chairs which was lovely. The food in the restaurant was quite good but the menu was very limited. The breakfast was great a good choice of breads, fruits, cereals and fried foods etc. The hotel was a few metres from the metro and on the line where you get of for all the tourist attractions. Having read some of the reviews on trip advisor I was abit anxious about the area as I was travelling alone but I found that it was quite safe and there was lots of bars and restaurants nearby so I didnt have to go to far.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: chockie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fab weekend at this hotel,was a bit worried about the area after some of the reviews I'd read but it was not a problem at all,infact the second night we stayed round about the hotel there are some great bars and restaurantes just outside the door we did not notice them to start with but thats because most people don't go out till late. The hotel was excellent,the rooms are very big and have everything you need,the bathroom was also good very clean and has a good shower and a hairdryer which is a big bonus. Breakfast was great,it really sets you up for the day, there was bacon,egg,fruit,toast,pastriesand I could go on and on. When we arrived we were checked in very quickly the reception staff can't do enough for you,they give you a map and tell you how to get about by metro and tram,the reception area is lovely it has large leather sofas and a smashing bar which is not expensive and it always seemed to be open. We walked nearly every where ,we did get the metro once which was very easy got off at marina stop which is ten mins walk away from hotel. We visited the harbour,the football ground,the cathedral ,the ramblers and the gothic quarters and still didn't do everything we will def go back and I would stay at the Pere IV again no doubt at all hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in not so fab area”
Reviews.Author: goodchick
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here on a Barcelona city break. It is a wonderful hotel with bright modern decor, marble floors and paintings and statues. Staff were very helpful and the breakfasts were excellent except the coffee which was rubbish and came out of a vending machine. The location is definitely dodgy and my mum got her pocket picked on the "conveniently located" metro nearby so I'd advise neck wallets for any travellers to this city. There was a lot of noise from kids partying in the street below til 6am on the weekend nights so I'd say pack the earplugs. The restaraunt in the hotel was so excellent we ate there 3 nights, seafood was a particular highlight. The pool isn;t up to much so I'd say its probably not suited to families with kids but its great for adults taking a break. The rooms are reasonably sized and very comfortable with a/c etc. I would stay here again if I ever go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JennyLH
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and two small children (aged 3 and 6). Hotel was very clean and well maintained. The staff were very helpful and friendly and spoke good English. The breakfast was buffet style with loads of choices which set us up for the day! The surroundings aren't great -(it's in an industrial/office area) - but only 5 minutes from Bogatell Metro station which takes you into the centre in 15 minutes. Buy a T10 metro ticket which gives you 10 journeys for 6.65 euros ( Beware of pickpockets on Metro - they twice tried to get in my bag!). In the evening it's only 15 minutes walk from the Hotel to the harbour which is very lively and has dozens of fantastic restaurants. My only complaint was that there weren't any fire instructions in our room (legal requirement?) which was a bit worrying on the 8th floor with two small children. Also we didn't have a view as our room looked onto a central courtyard area. Overall it was a really nice, reasonably priced hotel which I would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honey moon”
Reviews.Author: Irina&Kirill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pere IV Hotel for 5 nights of our Honey moon. The hotel pampered us with wonderfull room, teasty breakfast, helpfull stuff and great attitude. Pere IV is located just 3 minutes walk from the yellow line of the metro in a quiet location. Near by can be found many little restaurants and bars. We couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Pere is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Margaretannec
Reviews.Content: The Pere IV Hotel, though not in the centre of Barcelona, was an excellent centre to stay in, and conveniently close to the Bogatell underground station. It was easily close enough to the beach to walk, and we did actually walk all the way from the hotel to Barceloneta and the Ramblas and back via Parc de la Ciutadella on the first day. This is not recommended for the feet, however! Public transport and taxis make it easy to get around from the hotel, and the staff were very efficient about ordering taxis, wake up calls, room service etc. Unusually bright decor, but very clean, very comfortable and an enjoyable stay. Margaret, Manchester.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkSR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend break and I had no complaints. It was clean, well maintained and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room facilities were excellent even though it was a bit small for my liking. The room and bathroom were in a great condition and very clean. The breakfast buffet on the first floor really surpassed my expectations, there was an excellent choice of food and there was no problem with going back up for more. There is really only one downside to this hotel and this is the reason I am only giving it a 4; it is the location. The hotel is well away from the main centre of Barcelona which was a annoying at night. It was ok during the day as there is a Metro about 3/4 minutes walk away and you can access the main tourist spots fairly quickly. The neighbourhood may look a bit dodgy but it is perfectly safe.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Establishment!”
Reviews.Author: IrishPaddy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in October 2006 and found it to be excellent. It is nicely decorated, clean and comfortable and the staff were extremely polite and helpful. The concierge brought out a tourist map and in no time had gone through the attractions with us, along with how to navigate the metro. One slight gripe was its distance from the centre was a lot farther than advertised on needahotel.com, but taxis were cheap and readily available, in addition to the convenience of the metro. It's not in the prettiest part of town, but the area is quite safe and is abviously being redeveloped with trendy apartments. Overall, an excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “Loved Pere IV”
Reviews.Author: Roxy1717
Reviews.Content: We loved our two week stay at Pere IV!!! I recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona. It was very close to the metro stop, Bogatell. There were many small restaurants in the local area, one great one on the same block, who sold fantastic potatoes with garlic mayonaise. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. Everyone was so friendly and kind. The rooms were well kept and decorarted well. I must say i loved breakfast, I could never miss it, it was the highlight of each morning. The variety of breads, fruits, eggs, drinks, and pastrys were to die for. When I go back to Barcelona, I am staying at Pere IV again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Read the Previous Reviews”
Reviews.Author: BriggsHill
Reviews.Content: For the most part, the reviews written here are very accurate. The hotel is very nice and the staff very helpful. The Bogatell Metro stop is a couple of blocks away and very convenient to the places we wanted to go. If you don't want to be in the center of activity with the attendant hustle and bustle, and you don't mind stepping around the dog do-do on the sidewalk and the less than attractive neighborhood, this hotel might be for you. It's a question of trade-offs, budget and how fussy you are about the area you stay in. I liked it better than two other Barcelona hotels we have stayed in, but my wife would have preferred a different neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad location. Stay in Gothic quarter!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Pere IV is nicely decorated and the staff is very professional. They took endless pains to accommodate my wife and baby daughter, who had come along at the last minute, and they managed to put us in an excellent room on the top floor with a balcony overlooking the city...even though it was a very busy weekend due to Formula I races. There is a superb restaurant on the ground floor. Although the Pere IV is about two blocks from the metro, it is about 10 blocks from anything interesting by walking. In contrast, when we moved to a hotel in the Gothic Quarter near Las Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya, and the waterfront, that area is incredibly vibrant and exciting, with restaurants and little shops lining all the streets and alleys. If you had been to Barcelona, you wouldn't even be considering the Pere IV because you know how great those other areas are. Around the Pere IV, you'll see a lot of graffiti, car repair shops, pool halls, bars, and empty buildings, no nice restaurants that we could see. We did not feel very safe in the neighborhood although we did not have any problems. I feel bad about saying these negative things because the hotel staff was so nice to us, and the hotel itself is great. On the plus side, if you can get a room on the 8th or 9th (top) floor with a balcony, you'll have an incredible view of the city. Don't expect carpet in your room, no matter where you stay. All the hotels we saw had either hardwood or marble floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: DollyDimpel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over an April weekend with 20 friends. The hotel staff are very friendly and welcoming. The hotel is mainly non smoking but does have some smoking rooms. There seemed to be alot of same sex groups in this hotel but there werent any 'rowdies'. There is a security man on duty at night and the bar closes at 12. The rooms were clean and fresh and the bonus is the free mini bar (soft drinks only). The bar is replenished every day by the friendly domestic staff. Breakfast was fresh and hot and plenty of choice. If you need to know anything about the sights etc David the very friendly English barman is willing to advise. The indoor pool area was disapointing and very tired looking. One word of warning about the pool.... Beware of the chemicals! Following my one and only venture into the pool I surfaced with luminous green hair!! After 40 yrs of having blonde hair and never having a reaction before, this was quite a shock! The staff did however find me some tomato ketchup to use to neutralise it! The area isnt particularly exciting but it is a 5 minute walk to the metro into the city. It is also a 15 minute walk to the Port Olympic where there are many restaurants and bars. We ate in a fish restaurant here which didnt meet our expectations and thought it was rather pricey! I didnt like the way the staff at these restaurants 'touted' for business either as we walked by. The bars here stay open until 4-5am so if you are looking for a party atmosphere and dont want to go into the city, this is it! All in all a great hotel and value for money (we paid £103 each for 3 nights B/B). I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere, simply Love staying here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will have to give this hotel an excellent stars. we stayed here 18-20 april 2006. the sofa in every level of the hotel is very comfy. the room´s concept is very clean and neat and good stay. the closest is marina and bogatell metro. the staff is pleasant and very helpful. good experience in this hotel. Oh.. the double room bed is sooo comfy too. i have nothing to complain about this hotel. top !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel Pere IV as a family of 5. 2 adults and 3 children aged 8, 10 and 12 for a long weekend. We arrived tired from an early morning flight at approx 9am expecting to just pop in to the hotel to dump our luggage. The reception staff were wonderfully welcoming and it was a lovely and very welcome suprise that they had taken into account our early flight and had made our room up ready for us to use straight away. Details of our booking requirements for a triple room had not been passed on but staff arranged for us to use a room until another suitable room had been made up. Unfortunately our children had got carried away and had unpacked. The staff moved all of their luggage and put it away again for them without fuss. The hotel was spotless and comfortable, our rooms both the twin and triple were spacious and well equipt with hairdryer and toileteries. Free soft drinks from the mini bar were a nice touch. The view from our rooms was pretty 'urban' and nothing to write home about but didn't worry us. We tend not to spend our holidays looking out of our hotel windows. It was fun in the evening when the 'Gerkin' (building opposite) lights for a few hours. It was extremely handy for the Metro which is regular and efficient. Being slightly away from the main attractions meant that is was pretty quiet in the evening in terms of outside noise and sleeping. There was a little noise from the small club next door but it was not a problem. We felt safe walking around the area into the early hours even with the children. There is a small indoor pool and jacuzzi which was great for the children to chill out in but the pool is not really big enough to swim in properly. There is a small gym but we despite our good intentions did not have the energy to use. There was a good and varied selection of food for breakfast which didn't seem to run out towards the end of the morning. The quality was great and staff efficient. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bright, Very Welcoming and people laughing in the foyer, these were our first impressions. All receptionists were friendly and helpful ALL of the time. During the stay, we enjoyed the facilities which were well kept. We read these reviews before going and could agree that its a little out of the way of the main tourist flow, that said, we didnt have all the bustle or costs of that either and taxis were reasonable. Hotel Decor - Excellent Room Decor - Immaculate Room Services - Excellent Facilities - Excellent and IN WORKING ORDER Standards - Very Clean Value for Money - Excellent (We booked early) Would i stay again, - YES Would i reccomend it to anyone - DEFINATELY A great hotel and a very pleasant stay, i feel a lot of other Hotels who brag about their standards would struggle to achieve something as good as this. Well Done Hotel Pere IV

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: bebbles
Reviews.Content: We booked up for my Birthday and our Anniv.The hotel is lovely.Rooms are very nice and with a free mini bar.The staff were exceptionally helpful and would help in any way they could.They must have noticed from my passport that it was my birthday and sent us champagne and chocs(very nice).The breakfast was a feast,well worth the money of about £7.The evening meal was lovely(must book as restaurant is small)The hotel is minutes from the Metro which is connected very well to all attractions.The drinks and snacks in the bar area are very reasonable and very large measures.This is now a Non Smoking Hotel except on 2 floors in the bedrooms, so you do have to stand outside if you want to smoke.(This has now come into affect in most hotels as of January 2006)The area around the hotel at first looks a bit drab,but we had no probs at all about getting around or feeling safe there.We stay in many hotels and in many countries,but I would definately stay in this one again and have told all my friends about it.We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanCanLudlow
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a long weekend with 4 friends. Hotel lived up to previous reviewers comments. The rooms are comfortable, clean and stylish. The breakfast selection is impressive and good quality. We ate in for 2 nights (because we were too exhausted to go out) but the restaurant food was very good. The bar staff have a somewhat laid back approach to pouring drinks, erring on the rather generous side. Reception staff were efficient, friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. As I'd made the booking rather at the last minute I was a bit anxious about my friends comments but they too loved the place. Why only 'near perfect'? Well the area around the hotel has a lot of construction work going on - very little noise, more general upheaval. Also it is a little way out from the centre so after a hard day's sight seeing you either stay in the city centre to sample the night life or travel 20 mins back to the hotel to freshen up (and collapse). Finally there's no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and I did miss that first cup of the day. I hasten to add that the above are minor niggles and I'm planning to take my partner to the pere iv later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my husband away to Barcelona for a surprize 40th birthday present. We stayed at the Pere iv hotel. We loved it. Fantastic value!! Top floor room with balcony had stunning views, we could see the gothic cathedral and the funny shaped office block. The room was immaculate absolutely spotless, had freebies ie. soap, shower gel, comb, toothbrush and many more. Also had free mini bar stocked with loads of soft drinks. They even laid on a free bottle of champagne for my husbands birthday. The staff were excellent very helpful and spoke good english. The breakfast is very good value with an amazing choice of food, the restaurant is more fancy food very nice though. The area the hotel is situated looks a little run down but dont let this put you off, very close to metro station a 2 day pass will set you back about £4 and that has unlimited usage. WE CANNOT FAULT THIS HOTEL OR BARCELONA. Would definetly go back again. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR A WONDERFUL STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a not so good location but don't let that put you off.”
Reviews.Author: Arandora
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at this super value 4 star hotel. The area is in the process of being regenerated but whilst scruffy did not feel in any way threatening. Short walk to nearest Metro station (Bogotel) and a nice 35 minute after breakfast stroll to Las Ramblas. Sea front/Marina even shorter. Hitherto shuttered properties come to life nearby at night as bars/restaurants open, particularly on Saturday night. Wanting to stay local after a hard day's sightseeing, Reception recommended a local restaurant, the Portal del Mar, just turn right out of hotel front door, take second street on the right and its on corner of c/ Dr. Trueta and c/ Avila. They were right to. Though not cheap, it was excellent food, wine and service. The Pere IV itself is extremely well furnished, with loads of marble (take a look at Fire Escape!), good sized and equipped rooms, excellent buffet breakfast, very friendly and efficient staff and extremely lively and well visited bar (probably because of size of measures of spirits!!) No hesitation in recommending this fine hotel and would certainly revisit without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pere lV”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a girly weekend in Barcelona. The hotel was immaculate and very welcoming - the staff lovely, friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them when answering our queries. The bar area was spacious and the drinks a reasonable price for a hotel (wine 3euros/liquers 3euros). The bedrooms comfortable and tastefully decorated, plenty of bathroom compliments, comfort a priority. At breakfast we had a wide selection of choices in splendid surroundings a great start before hiking around the city. Will certainly stay there again and recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't do our homework on this hotel and were a little disappointed when we saw its location, the graffiti, the road works and the surrounding buildings etc. That said the price was good and so was the hotel as it turned out. Clean, comfortable and very convenient for the very efficient and cheap Barcelona city Metro system and, in spite of the looks of the area and location of the hotel, at no time did my wife or I feel threatened, uncomfortable or greatly inconvenienced. The hotel bar prices were quite reasonable as was the breakfast. My wife was unfortunate enough to have her handbag stolen (we'd been warned again and again about this but we still got caught in the centre of the city whilst in a restaurant). Back at the hotel the Staff were brilliant providing free phone calls back to the UK, supplying emergency phone contact numbers (for banks and mobile company) and good advice about the procedures we needed to follow. The hotel safe and a sensible approach to what we carried at any point in time ensured that we weren’t left penniless. With the stealing of the bag we had no money left to pay our small restaurant bill and I was explaining that I'd have to return that evening with some cash when I was informed that a kindly young Spanish chap had paid our bill after expressing his shame that such a thing could happen in his city. Unfortunately he’d left by the time I found this out so I was unable to thank him - he hadn't sought any thanks or recognition! For the background… my wife and I are early fifities, travelled alone and went simply to enjoy the Spanish culture, a little shopping and some late sunshine. We weren’t disappointed on any front. The unfortunate handbag incident didn’t prevent us from enjoying this great city, the wonderful Spanish people or the Pere IV Hotel. It's a shame but a fact that any busy city harbours criminals intentent on parting you and your belongings. Don't let this put you off Barcelona. It wasn't voted the top 2005 world destination for nothing! Go and enjoy it just as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: volk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in may. The hotel is lovely. Top class rest. in which we had a beautiful meal and breakfast was out of this world. anything you could think of to eat for breakfast it was there. One word of warning. the location of the hotel is a littel suspect ie while it is close to port olympic the walk from the hotel to port olympic at night time will keep you on your toes. otherwise i cannot fault this hotel. i reckon it is the best value for money in barcelona and i have been to barcelona a couple of times. My parents stayed in this hotel also and they loved it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The internet rate for this 4 star hotel makes it worth staying there. All the amanities are great, and the breakfast buffet is awsome. My family and friends had a wonderful time, and I know I will be returning there some time again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BradP
Reviews.Content: This was a real pleasant surprise. After checking up on this hotel via this site, my wife and I were a little apprehensive about the Pere IV. We needn't have worried as this is a great little hotel. A few people had mentioned about it being in a 'dodgy' area with more graffitti than they had ever seen, but on our arrival this certainly wasn't the case. Barcelona as a whole has graffitti everywhere and yet is spotless litter-wise. So after alaying our fears about the area it is in a great spot, the Villa Olympic with all its bars and restaurants is about a 10 minute walk away and the underground (Bogatell) is just round the corner if you want to venture a little further. The hotel itself is really nice and on our arrival was given a map and told the places we should go to by the check in staff, who spoke excellent English. We were on the top floor to the back of the hotel and although the view isn't spectacular you could see the Villa Olympic hotels on the horizon. Our room was very large, though we believe all the rooms wern't like this as below us the rooms were definately much smaller. I wasn't impressed with the swimming pool area as it seemed like an afterthought and is very small and dimly lit. It also had an excessive amount of chlorine in it. The jacuzzi was not very warm either but the sauna was fine and the gym area was okay. We had paid for the breakfast and this is well worth it. They had just about every type of breakfast you could wish for! The restaurant was okay but was too posh for it's own good, the food was nice but the ambience was non existent. We also had to walk up to the top floor as one set of lifts which did go to the top floor was out of order. Barcelona itself is a great place, with some spectacular scenery and would recommend it highly. We also found it very safe, something which we had heard some people were wary of.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our 5 night stay at the Pere IV Hotel. Although not in the centre of Barcelona, the metro is just around the corner and four stops takes you into the centre. Although not a 'pretty' location, we found it absolutely fine - it was quiet in the evenings as there is very little traffic (and people come to that) and we felt quite safe walking back from the Port Olympic area late at night. The staff at the hotel are extremely helpful and the breakfasts are great - every you could possibly want. We also appreciated the free soft drink in the mini bar. If you are planning a stay at the Pere IV I would strongly suggest you request a room to the front of the building. The room we had was in the middle of the building and although the room itself was well appointed and had everything we need it didn't get much daylight (very little infact). We travelled from Prestwick Airport to Girona Airport and the bus transfer was very easy. Just behind the baggage carousel there is a little window where you buy your bus ticket. There has been a change to where the bus drops off/picks up, this caused us a sliight hiccup on the way back to the airport as our taxi driver obviously didn't know about the change and dropped us off at the old pick up point !! The bus now leaves from the Estacio del Nord - please make sure your taxi driver knows this. Barcelona itself is a wonderful city. There is just so much to see and do. We thoroughly recommend the 2 day bus pass on Tourist Bus, it's well worth the 21 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but.....”
Reviews.Author: DCJSwindon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, Staff very very helpful nothing too much trouble, people on reception especially helpful. Decor is a bit odd Bright yellow/Red /Orange in breakfast room.....still wakes you up in the morning... Main restaurant ....Special evening menu mon--fri excellent incl wine & coffee 3 courses for 19 euros...great. Just an odd location ........but quite near Sagrada familia

Reviews.Title: “Safe and sound!”
Reviews.Author: listsforever
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four day 'girlie' stay with my 12 year old daughter, my first time abroad alone! The hotel was comfortable - I chose this one for the pool facilities and although small, we used them every night. Yes, the location looks dreadful but I felt quite safe. We used the metro regularly; it is fantastic. We walked to the beach (15 mins) once. To and from the airport we used taxis (25 euros at peak traffic time) as two girls alone we felt safer initially doing that, but now I would feel fine about using the public transport system. Yes, I would stay here again. It is certainly quieter than the Ramblas hotels in the evenings (and minus the 'ladies of the night' that congregate there). The staff were exceptionally helpful - advice, reassurance for a neurotic mother, and maps! Do use the 'Bus Touristic' to get your bearings around the city and visit the key places! Top floor of El Corte Ingles in the Placa de Catalunya does a self-service lunch, with amazing views over the city. But I digress from the hotel... Hotel is great, rooms are clean and comfortable and well-equiped (except tea and coffee stuff, which is through room service), restaurant is fine, 19e for 3 course meal incl. wine, and so to is the room service food. Don't worry about the location - we wandered around it all and felt safe.
